page.title: 03WOOLHOPE LANDSCAPE (2)
page.content: {A Tudor Landslip - The Wonder of {1575 AD } In February 1575, probably after heavy rain, a deep layer of rock over clay slid down the Eastern slope of Marcle Hill for about 150m and swept away Kynaston Chapel. According to contemporary accounts Marcle Hill roared and moved for three days, 26 acres of land were shifted and the hill was higher afterwards. At 0363402365 there is a splendid view of the remains of the Wonder and surrounding countryside as far as Ledbury, Malvern Hills, May Hill & the Cotswold Ridge.
